page.title: 06Housing
page.content: The main settlement in our area at study are the villages of Penyfford and Penymynydd.Both of these villages have developed in a linear fashion in the main Hawrden to Wrexham road ,the A 550. The population at these two villages, has gone up from about 1 000 in the 1950's to around 2 000 today because of the building of new estates and the population is still rising. The centre of the vilage is composed of old turn of the century houses which are grouped around the village shops.The inhabitants of these houses are mainly old people. The outskirts of the town are made up of modern housing estates, here the houses built 20 - 45 years ago are Semi-detached or Detached.Here the inhabitants are mainly young families. By Lorraine Tyson and Alison Jones.
